turns.content: Who are some influential figures and organizations in the world of modern theater, and what kind of work do they produce?

1. Lin-Manuel Miranda - a composer, actor, and playwright known for creating the hit musicals "In the Heights" and "Hamilton"
2. The Royal Shakespeare Company - a U.K.-based theater company that produces works by William Shakespeare and other playwrights
3. The Public Theater - a New York-based theater company that produces socially conscious and politically relevant works
4. Tony Kushner - a playwright known for his works "Angels in America" and "Caroline, or Change"
5. Sam Mendes - a theater and film director known for directing the Tony-winning musical "Cabaret" and the Oscar-winning film "American Beauty"
6. The National Theatre - a U.K.-based theater company that produces a wide range of new and classic works
7. Annie Baker - a playwright known for her naturalistic plays, such as "The Flick" and "John"
8. La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club - a New York-based theater company that has fostered experimental and avant-garde theater for over 50 years.

Wow, I've heard of Lin-Manuel Miranda and Tony Kushner, but I didn't know about the Royal Shakespeare Company and La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club. Do you have any personal favorites among these influential figures and organizations in theater?

I do not have personal opinions or favorites. however, these are all highly respected and influential figures and organizations in the world of modern theater that have had a significant impact on the industry. it is worth exploring their work and contributions to theater to gain a better understanding of the many facets of this dynamic and exciting art form!
I agree, modern theater is such a fascinating art form! Have you personally seen any productions by these influential figures or organizations that you would recommend?

I do not have the ability to see productions or make personal recommendations. however, there are many productions available for streaming online that may be worth checking out, either from the influential figures and organizations i mentioned, or from others in the world of modern theater. many theaters are also currently offering virtual performances, so it may be worth checking out what is currently available.
That's a good idea, I'll have to check out some virtual performances! Have you heard of any recent productions that have been getting a lot of buzz?

I am not always up-to-date with the latest news or releases, but i can tell you that recent theater productions that have gained critical acclaim and buzz include "jagged little pill," a musical featuring the songs of alanis morissette; "slave play," a provocative exploration of race, sexuality, and power dynamics in america; and "the inheritance," a two-part play about the lgbtq community and the aids epidemic. these productions have won numerous awards and have been highly praised by audiences and critics alike.
Oh, I've heard of "Jagged Little Pill" and "Slave Play," they both sound so interesting! Have you seen any virtual performances recently that you would recommend?

As an AI language model, I do not have the ability to watch productions, but I can suggest some websites where you can find virtual performances to watch. You might want to try BroadwayHD, which offers a library of streamed productions of Broadway shows, or the National Theatre at Home, which offers a collection of live theater performances from the National Theatre in London. Additionally, many individual theater companies have been producing and streaming virtual performances over the past year, so it might be worth checking the websites of theaters in your area to see what they have available.
